intro: Trigoniastrum, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of a single species, Trigoniastrum africanum, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It has a woody stem and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Trigoniastrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
